title: Quiz 7: Maternal Physiological Changes
description: Assessment of systemic changes in the mother during pregnancy (CV, Renal, GI, etc.).

questions.question: What causes 'Physiological Anaemia' in pregnancy?

richContent.content: Scenario: A pregnant woman has an Hb of 11 g/dl. Why is this considered normal?

options.text: Plasma volume increases more than red cell mass (Haemodilution)

questions.explanation: Plasma volume increases by ~50%, while red cells increase by only ~18%, diluting the blood.

questions.question: The cervical plug of mucus that acts as a barrier against infection during pregnancy is called the ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: The Operculum is the mucus plug filling the cervical canal.

questions.question: Which Gastrointestinal changes occur due to the relaxing effect of Progesterone? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Progesterone relaxes smooth muscle, causing reflux, slow digestion, and constipation.

questions.question: What is the expected total weight gain during a normal pregnancy?
questions.explanation: The average weight gain is approximately 12 kg (fetus, placenta, fluid, fat, blood, etc.).
questions.hint: It is roughly 2kg in the first 20 weeks, then 0.5kg/week.

questions.question: What is the name of the dark pigmented line that may run from the pubis to the umbilicus during pregnancy?
questions.explanation: Linea Nigra is the dark line caused by melanin stimulation.

questions.question: During pregnancy, the ureters dilate and may kink, leading to urinary stasis and increased risk of infection.
questions.explanation: Progesterone relaxes the ureteral walls, causing dilation and stasis.

questions.question: How does cardiac output change during pregnancy?

options.text: Increases from 5 to 7 litres per minute

questions.explanation: Cardiac output increases to meet the metabolic demands of the mother and fetus.
questions.hint: The heart has to work harder.

questions.question: Match the skin change with its description:

pairs.right: Patchy coloring on the face (Mask of pregnancy)

questions.explanation: Chloasma (Face), Striae (Stretch marks), Linea Nigra (Abdomen line).
questions.hint: Chloasma is on the face; Striae are marks.
